definition: to turn (a corner etc)/to kidnap/to swindle/to misappropriate/walking stick/crutch/seven (used as a substitute for 七[qi1])

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: He and Jim are joined by two tricksters.
sentences.chinese: 他和吉姆遇到了两个拐子。

sentences.english: Wild beasts may have been frightening, but these two kidnapers were even more terrible.
sentences.chinese: 野兽虽然可怕，这两个拐子更是恐怖。

sentences.english: Elbowing is a foul in basketball.
sentences.chinese: 打拐子在棒球比赛中是犯规动作。

sentences.english: Lieutenant quietly sent changjiang and guaizi horse on the track.
sentences.chinese: 中尉悄悄的派一剪梅和拐子马对其进行跟踪。

definition: wooden club (used to beat clothes in washing)
baby/small child/(arch.) slave among ethnic minorities
tail/end/small change/odd sum remaining after large round number
to turn (a corner etc)/to kidnap/to swindle/to misappropriate/walking stick/crutch/seven (used as a substitute for 七[qi1])
